titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid for the Linda Garber papers, 1980-1994 LSC.1958
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Stacy Wood, 2011 and Sabrina Ponce, 2017; machine-readable finding aid created by Caroline Cub√©.

p.date: Online finding aid last updated 29 August 2017.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-09-02 10:52:39 -0700.

did.abstract: Linda Garber is an associate professor of Women's and Gender Studies at Santa Clara University. She received her BA in English and American Literature as well as her teaching credentials from Harvard in 1987. She received her MA in Modern Thoughts and Literature from Stanford University in 1990 and completed her PhD with the same department in 1995. She has held positions at both Santa Clara University and California State University, Fresno. While the collection contains a few items relating to the Lesbian Studies Reader and other academic activities, the majority of the collection covers the publication of Garber's anthology, Tilting the Tower, documenting the collection, permissions, editing, and revising processes.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

acqinfo.head: Provenance/Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This collection is part of an outreach and collection-building partnership between the June L. Mazer Lesbian Archives, the UCLA Center for the Study of Women (CSW) and the UCLA Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Linda Garber Papers (Collection 1958). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Stacy Wood, 2011. Description enhanced and further physical processing completed by Sabrina Ponce in 2017.

The June L. Mazer Lesbian Archive at UCLA is an outreach and collection-building partnership between the June L. Mazer Lesbian Archives, the UCLA Center for the Study of Women (CSW) and the UCLA Library. These collections expand the pool of primary source materials available to researchers and to the community at large. This partnership was initiated by CSW and is funded by the National Endowment for the Humanities (NEH) to inventory, organize, preserve, and digitize more than eighty Mazer collections pertaining to lesbian and feminist activism and writings.

Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Linda Garber is an associate professor of Women's and Gender Studies at Santa Clara University. She received her BA from Harvard in English and American Literature in 1987. She also received her teaching credentials in the same year from Harvard. She received her MA from Stanford University in the Modern Thoughts and Literature program in 1990 and completed her PhD in the same department in 1995. She has held positions at both Santa Clara University and California State University Fresno.

She has published three books: Identity Poetics: Race, Class, and the Lesbian - Feminist Roots of Queer Theory, New York: Columbia University Press, 2001; Tilting the Tower: Lesbians/Teaching/Queer Subjects, New York: Routledge, 1994. Editor; and Lesbian Sources: A Biliography of Periodical Articles, 1970-1990, New York: Garland, 1993.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: While the collection has a few items relating to the Lesbian Studies Reader and other academic activities, the majority of the collection covers the publication of the anthology, Tilting the Tower, including collecting, editing, permissions and revisions.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is split between materials not included in Tilting the Tower and materials included in Tilting the Tower. Material is arranged chronologically within those categories. This collection does not contain a Box 4.

p.extref: Guide to the Stanford University, School of Humanities and Sciences, Innovative Academic Courses, Records
Guide to the Stanford University, Michelle R. Clayman Institute for Gender Research, Records

controlaccess.subject: Gay and lesbian studies.
controlaccess.corpname: June L. Mazer Lesbian Archive at UCLA

did.unittitle: The Feminist Press and Lesbian Studies

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence with Feminist Press concerning the release of Lesbian Studies and Lesbian Studies II. Also included is correspondence between Garber and Margaret "Peg" Cruikshank, with whom Garber edited the Lesbian Studies publications, and correspondence regarding the controversy surrounding a breach of contract.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence with authors who were not included in the Tilting the Tower anthology, with some of the letters concerning works discussed for inclusion in future anthologies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Essays, published and unpublished, by contributors to Tilting the Tower but not included in the anthology.

did.physdesc: bound program guides, flyers, printed paper, newsletters

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Calls for papers and proposals for various feminist and gender studies conferences, collections, workshops, and anthologies.

did.unittitle: Tilting the Tower: Correspondence with Contributors

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letters with contributors concerning editorial choices, status of articles, and other business revolving around Tilting the Tower and other collaborative projects.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Copies of essays considered but ultimately rejected by Linda Garber for Tilting the Tower , filed alphabetically by author's last name.

did.unittitle: Tilting the Tower: Correspondence with Routledge

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence with the publisher of Tilting the Tower concerning contracts, deadlines, advances, editorial issues, permissions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Biographies and blurbs submitted by contributing authors to be included in Tilting the Tower.

did.unittitle: Tilting the Tower: Correspondence with Editors

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence including editorial suggestions and grammar corrections with those involved in the process of copy and content editing.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Permissions agreements and payment agreements between Linda Garber and the contributing authors for Tilting the Tower.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Annotated, proofread drafts of submissions for Tilting the Tower. Linda Garber's introduction is first, thereafter in alphabetical order by author's last name.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Drafts of essays for Tilting the Tower.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Final drafts of Tilting the Tower.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Final page proofs for Tilting the Tower, with some notes at the end.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A copy of Tilting the Tower published by Routledge.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Advertisement for a book signing event of Tilting the Tower.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Index cards cataloging journal articles of interest to Linda Garber, organized alphabetically by publication, therein alphabetically by author.
